verses.roman:
madīyaṁ mahimānaṁ ca
paraṁ brahmeti śabditam
vetsyasy anugṛhītaṁ me
sampraśnair vivṛtaṁ hṛdi

synonyms: madīyam—pertaining to Me; mahimānam—glories; ca—and; param brahma—the Supreme Brahman, the Absolute Truth; iti—thus; śabditam—celebrated; vetsyasi—you shall understand; anugṛhītam—being favored; me—by Me; sampraśnaiḥ—by inquiries; vivṛtam—thoroughly explained; hṛdi—within the heart.
translation: You will be thoroughly advised and favored by Me, and because of your inquiries, everything about My glories, which are known as paraṁ brahma, will be manifest within your heart. Thus you will know everything about Me.

purport.content:
teṣām evānukampārthamaham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ
nāśayāmy ātma-bhāvasthojñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā
"Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge the darkness born of ignorance."
